Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the role of Chad Sevearance as the "leader" of opposition to the bathroom bill in North Carolina.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that Chad Sevearance is the leader of the opposition.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Chad Sevearance was convicted of sexual contact with minors in 1998.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that being a registered sex offender automatically disqualifies someone from opposing a "bathroom bill."
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for Chad Sevearance's involvement in opposing the bathroom bill that are not explored in the claim.
